Title: Data Analyst Working Student
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world’s leading sexual wellbeing company. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a smooth online shopping experience.

Lovehoney employs over 900 awesome, diverse & driven people throughout our 9 offices across the globe, celebrating a broad spectrum of talents in engineering, industrial design, sales, and marketing.

We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers’ lives.

We are currently recruiting a Working Student Data Analyst who will be integral to driving high-level performance across Lovehoney Group. Your focus will be on leveraging our technology stack to derive insights and support various teams within the business.

What You Will Do


Utilize tools like Google Analytics, Big Query, Airflow, Tableau, and Superset to analyse data from our group data warehouse
Collaborate with finance, marketing, and product teams to produce reporting capabilities and insights
Develop visualizations and storytelling to communicate complex data analysis in an understandable manner
Understand and apply core e-commerce KPIs in your analysis
Utilize your analytical and problem-solving skills to identify trends and insights



What You Should Bring


Currently enrolled in a degree in business, mathematics, science, or engineering
Experience in writing and reviewing SQL queries
Proficiency in building visualizations and data storytelling
Understanding of core e-commerce KPIs
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, and friendly faces, as well as a range of benefits that make working with us an unforgettable experience.
Fun team-building events, including dinners, barbecues, and games, that bring our team together and foster a sense of community
Discount Shopping Portal: Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers through Perks at Work.
A hybrid work model that allows for flexibility and work-life balance, with three days a week in-office
25 holiday days a year, plus an extra day for every year you are with Lovehoney, giving you plenty of time to rest, recharge, and explore



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we leverage artificial intelligence as part of our screening interview process, for note-taking purposes. Rest assured, we prioritize transparency and respect candidates' preferences. You'll have the option to opt out while still receiving fair consideration for the role.

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Job Description

Data Analyst (m/f/d)

THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.

THE ROLE We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our innovative and international Data & Insights team. By understanding the data needs of our stakeholders, you'll provide valuable insights and clear recommendations to support our data-driven decision-making process.

What You'll Do


Dive into complex marketing data sets to uncover trends and insights that drive key business decisions. Your work will have a direct impact on the strategy and growth of our group companies
Collaborate with a forward-thinking team that embraces the latest technologies and methodologies. We believe in continuous learning and innovation
Partner closely with team members and external business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectives
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making



Requirements

WHAT YOU'LL BRING


At least 3 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficient in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Marketing Data and Analytics, as well as Retail Media and Customer Analytics would be a big plus
Familiarity with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Strong abilities in generating reports using data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
A passion for learning, hands-on work, taking ownership, and making an impact
Fluent in German and English



What We Offer


Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year’s Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child’s sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to €1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
In house conversational German classes for beginners
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Premium relocation support for colleagues outside of Germany: visa application support, assistance with searching temporary accommodation, payment of the first monthly rent
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners

Show more

  • Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
  • Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners

Title: Junior Data Analyst (Intern)
Description:
We are a Berlin-based startup that has successfully established a leading B2B marketplace for industrial metals across Europe.

The multi-billion-euro metal trading industry is operated on Excel, PDF and Email. We are on a mission to transform buying and selling in one of the oldest industries of the modern world with seamless and intuitive digital solutions. Our technologies increase liquidity, accelerate transactions, reduce scrapping rates and enhance buying convenience for hundreds of steel and metal distributors across Europe.

As a lean team of young, international, and passionate talents, we've recently reached breakeven and are gearing up for the next phase of growth. We are looking for an outstanding individual who wants to join an exciting early stage start-up as a Junior Data Analyst (Intern) to work closely with our senior management and a highly motivated team.

Tasks

As Junior Data Analyst (Intern), you will join the team full-time for a 3-6 months internship and support the Data Team in providing data insights to the broader organizations. Specifically you will:


Collaborate with your team members to design, implement and maintain data processing pipelines
Assist in defining the vision and objectives for data products by working closely with product and data team members
Develop high-performing and insightful dashboards by providing necessary data infrastructure
Implement automated monitoring tools to ensure data accuracy and reliability
Engage proactively with cross-functional teams to identify and implement pragmatic solutions to business problems
Contribute to the continuous improvement of data engineering processes and best practices
Leverage your technical skills to process and analyze data using Excel, SQL, and Python
Analyze and interpret data on available & sold inventory, transactions and customer data and make recommendations for action



Requirements


First experience working on projects using Python with data processing frameworks
Strong skills in Google Sheet (Excel) and SQL
Ability to process and analyze data effectively to drive insights and action
Exceptional attention to detail, ensuring high standards are maintained across all tasks
Recent graduate (ideally available for a full-time role after the internship)
Studies in Data Analytics, Data Science or any other quantitative discipline
First experience with Looker, Tableau or other dashboarding tools
Entrepreneurial drive, genuine curiosity and hands-on mentality
A self-starter with a track record of achievements
Solid organizational and time management skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proficiency in English



Benefits


First hand experience with an exciting Berlin tech startup on a steep growth curve
Work closely with an experienced team, keen to train and invest in you
Fast-paced environment and strong company culture for high performing individuals
Unrivaled autonomy and ownership
Open and fun shared working environment/culture
Office located in the heart of Berlin
Competitive compensation, depending on experience

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Carhartt WIP is part of the WIP Trading AG. Our family-owned business group started as a licensee and European distributor of the US workwear manufacturer Carhartt in the early 1990s. Since then, it develops its own collections based on workwear originals.




Carhartt Work In Progress aims to continuously progress and evolve, without ever losing sight of its origins. Over the course of the past two decades, our business has developed organically, along with its customers, the culture that surrounds the brand, and its employees who have helped shape what Carhartt WIP is today.




Your Responsibilities:

Management of and participation in Ecom&ERP projects in the BI environment
Implementation of change requests from the Ecom/CRM Team in the BI environment
Close cooperation with external service providers and partners
Ensuring operation & support for the BI systems of the Carhartt WIP Ecom&APP
Technical contact for the BI architecture in the ERP/Ecom environment




Your Profile:

Very good technical understanding of ERP, Commercetools and DWH architecture
At least 5 years of professional experience in a comparable function
Experience in working with Power BI is a plus
Entrepreneurial mindset and high customer orientation
Hands on and agile Mindset
Very good process understanding in the ecom&retail landscape
Very good technological understanding in the reporting area
Good analytical and logical thinking skills
Very good communication skills




Your Benefits:

Be part of the progress - find your place in our unique WIP culture
As part of the WIP crew you have the opportunity to connect at our events or just have fun
Your closet benefits from our staff discounts
Your future, our upgrade - we subsidise your company pension scheme by 100%
Your well-being is important to us - we contribute to this with free beverages




Your Location:

Berlin (Kreuzberg) / Germany

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst - Python / SQL / Clean Energy / Hydrogen / Data Engineer




Interested in using your Data Analysis / Engineering background to help tackle some of the biggest challenges in the Clean Technology market?




You'll join a team that are a market leader in the production and storage of Green Hydrogen, who have recently started looking for a Senior Energy Data Analyst to join their team in Berlin (Hybrid / Remote available).




The role:




As a key member of the team's Data group you'll enjoy a lot of responsibility, and will take a lead role in designing the structure of the existing database, analyse weather and market price data, and act as the interface between the electricity market, RES generation, and in-house Hydrogen production teams.




What's on offer?




A very competitive compensation package.




The chance to enjoy a lot of responsibility as part of a small team of experts
A hands-on engineering role with one of the best funded Clean Technology teams in the industry




Ideally you'll have a combination of:




Python
SQL

Title: Data Analyst (d/m/w)
Description:
Sind Sie auf der Suche nach neuen und spannenden Herausforderungen? Dann beginnen Sie Ihre Karriere bei uns und werden Sie Teil eines unserer Kundenprojekte.




IHRE AUFGABENSCHWERPUNKTE

Extrahierung und Sammlung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, darunter Logdateien, Datenbanken und Monitoring-Tools
Bereinigung, Transformation und Standardisierung von Daten, um ihre Qualität und Konsistenz sicherzustellen
Automatisierung von Datenerfassungs- und Bereinigungsprozessen
Durchführung von Leistungsanalysen und Erstellung von Prognosemodellen
Entwicklung von Dashboards und Berichten zur Visualisierung von Leistungsindikatoren, Sicherheitsmetriken und anderen relevanten Kennzahlen







WAS SIE DAFÜR MITBRINGEN

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Datenwissenschaft, Statistik oder einem verwandten Bereich
Mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse, vorzugsweise im IT-Bereich
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Datenbankabfragesprachen wie SQL sowie Programmierkenntnisse in Python, R oder ähnlichen Sprachen
Erfahrung mit Tools und Technologien zur Datenvisualisierung, wie z.B. Tableau, Grafana oder Kibana
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, komplexe technische Probleme zu lösen
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse







WARUM SIE BEI UNS GENAU RICHTIG SIND

Es besteht die Möglichkeit zum Teil remote zu arbeiten und somit von den Vorteilen hybrider Arbeit zu profitieren (flexibles Arbeiten)
Teamspirit und Diversität
Work-Life-Balance
Attraktive Vergütung
Sozialleistungen
Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Team- und Sportevents
Globales Netzwerk
Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm







Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits.




Senden Sie uns direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung.




Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music publisher worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.




BMG’s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. We’re transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.




We are currently seeking an experienced Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. As a seasoned Data Analyst, you will guide junior analysts and collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!




What you’ll be doing

Process big data volumes, modeling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (e.g. Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs
Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Finance)
Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business
Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products
Interact with developers, data engineers, and management to propose new technologies, processes and system improvements, as well as global data governance strategies
Provide training and mentorship to junior team members, empowering them to excel in their contributions to the team’s projects
Develop sustainable processes and methodologies to support the effectiveness of our Data Analytics function




What you bring

Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python
Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau
Broad understanding of data analysis methods and storytelling
Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
Strong interest to mentor junior colleagues with enthusiasm and expertise
Capability to plan and implement projects independently
Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment




It’s also a plus if you have…

Team leadership experience
Prior music industry experience
Experience with GCP, dbt and Git
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
Understanding of statistical methods and ML
Experience using ETL frameworks




What we offer

A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work.
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees.
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters.
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team.




This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

Show more
HTML:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music publisher worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.


BMG’s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. We’re transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.


We are currently seeking an experienced Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. As a seasoned Data Analyst, you will guide junior analysts and collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!


What you’ll be doing

  • Process big data volumes, modeling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (e.g. Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs
  • Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Finance)
  • Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business
  • Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products
  • Interact with developers, data engineers, and management to propose new technologies, processes and system improvements, as well as global data governance strategies
  • Provide training and mentorship to junior team members, empowering them to excel in their contributions to the team’s projects
  • Develop sustainable processes and methodologies to support the effectiveness of our Data Analytics function


What you bring

  • Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
  • Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
  • Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau
  • Broad understanding of data analysis methods and storytelling
  • Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
  • Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
  • Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
  • Strong interest to mentor junior colleagues with enthusiasm and expertise
  • Capability to plan and implement projects independently
  • Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment


It’s also a plus if you have…

  • Team leadership experience
  • Prior music industry experience
  • Experience with GCP, dbt and Git
  • Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
  • Understanding of statistical methods and ML
  • Experience using ETL frameworks


What we offer

  • A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work.
  • Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
  • Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
  • Long-term career opportunities for all employees.
  • A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters.
  • Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team.


This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

Title: (Junior) Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Deine Aufgaben

Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine*n engagierte*n und versierte*n (Junior) Data Analyst (m/w/d),

um unser Data-Team zu verstärken. In dieser Position kümmerst du dich um die eigenständige Beschaffung und Analyse von Social Media Daten sowie die Entwicklung und Umsetzung von effektiven Analyseansätzen und Lösungsideen.

Du entwickelst gerne kreative Analyseansätze und Lösungsideen?

Du bist ein echter Data-Storyteller und hast Lust in einem jungen, dynamischen Umfeld zu arbeiten?

Klingt spannend? Dann bewirb dich noch heute!


Du wertest Leistungsdaten über alle relevanten Social-Media-Kanäle hinweg aus und identifizierst dabei wichtige Trends und Muster
Mit modernsten Analysetools deckst du Potenziale auf und optimierst unsere Strategien.
Du leitest aus den Daten relevante Erkenntnisse ab und präsentierst diese in klaren, überzeugenden Empfehlungen an unsere Teams und Kunden.
Du optimierst und automatisierst Datenverarbeitungsprozesse und Workflows, um Effizienz und Genauigkeit zu steigern.
Du bereitest Daten visuell auf und erstellst aussagekräftige Dashboards, die auch komplexe Zusammenhänge verständlich darstellen.
Du unterstützt interdisziplinäre Projektteams mit deinem analytischen Know-how und trägst dazu bei, datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu treffen
Du entwickelst kreative Analyseansätze und findest innovative Lösungen für komplexe Herausforderungen
Du entwickelst und implementierst Datenstrategien zur Optimierung von Geschäftsprozessen


Du bringst mit


Mindestens 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung mit Fokus auf quantitativer Research in einer Agentur, Unternehmen oder Unternehmensberatung
Du sprichst Deutsch auf muttersprachlichem Niveau und verfügst über sehr gute Englischkenntnisse
Du bist kreativ und findest in Kollaboration innovative Lösungen für datenbezogene Herausforderungen
Du bringst Wissen über Datenanalyse, Data Mining, Methoden der Datenexploration und -modellierung sowie Datenvisualisierung mit
Du kennst dich mit diversen Analytics-Tools aus wie R, Python oder PowerBI
Um komplexe Daten verständlich zu präsentieren und fundierte Empfehlungen zu geben bringst du strake kommunikative und analytische Fähigkeiten ein
Du hast Lust auf ein dynamisches Themenfeld zwischen Data und Analytics
Kenntnisse in GenAI, Large Language Models (LLMs)
Das klingt spannend? Und zudem wohnst du auch in Berlin? Dann freuen wir uns über deine Bewerbung mit frühestem Eintrittstermin und deiner Gehaltsvorstellung.


Unser Versprechen

⭐️ Dynamisches Umfeld

Bei StoryMachine erwartet dich ein dynamisches Umfeld mit flachen Hierarchien, in dem deine Ideen und dein Verantwortungsbewusstsein gefragt sind.

⭐️ Persönliche Entwicklung

Du wirst von Anfang an herausfordernde und vielfältige Aufgaben erhalten, die dein Potenzial entfalten und deine persönliche Weiterentwicklung fördern. Zudem hast du die Möglichkeit, in deiner neuen Rolle eigenverantwortlich zu arbeiten und dich weiterzuentwickeln.

⭐️ Flexibilität

Wir bieten flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit, zwischen unserem Büro in Berlin Mitte und Home Office zu wählen.

⭐️ Feedback-Kultur

Wir legen Wert auf regelmäßige Feedback-Gespräche, bei denen wir nicht nur dir Feedback geben, sondern auch dein Feedback einfordern.

⭐️ Teamgeist

Bei uns findest du ein herzliches, diverses und ambitioniertes Team, das gemeinsam Großes erreichen möchte. Ebenso organisieren wir regelmäßige Team-Events wie wöchentliche Teamlunches und verschiedene gemeinsame Aktivitäten.

⭐️ Work-Life-Balance

Wir setzen uns für eine gesunde Work-Life-Balance ein und unterstützen dich dabei, Beruf und Privatleben in Einklang zu bringen. Zur Unterstützung in jeder Lebensphase bieten wir den vollen Service von , der ganzheitlichen Plattform für mentale Gesundheit, an.

Über uns

StoryMachine ist eine 2017 gegründete Agentur mit dem Schwerpunkt auf strategischem Storytelling für Brands, Persönlichkeiten und politische Institutionen. Die Basis unseres integrativen Storytellings ist journalistisch und komplett datengetrieben. Wir betrachten Social Channels nicht isoliert, sondern heben ihre Stärken und Besonderheiten hervor und bringen sie zum Vorteil unserer Kund*innen ein.

Unser Büro befindet sich in einem alten Varieté-Theater mitten im Herzen von Berlin. Dort triffst du auf einzigartige Charakterköpfe als Kolleg*innen und in regelmäßigen Networking-Events auf bekannte Personen aus der Politik-, Wirtschaft- und Medienwelt.

Klingt nice? Geht noch besser!

Bei StoryMachine schreibst du Geschichte(n) – und bekommst dafür den Freiraum, um dich kreativ zu entfalten und Verantwortung zu übernehmen.

Du bist als Mitarbeiter*in von StoryMachine von spannenden Kund*innen aus verschiedensten Branchen, vom Hidden Champion über DAX-Konzerne bis hin zu internationalen Top-Brands involviert.

Title: Data Analyst, Finance & Strategy
Description:
About Gelato

Gelato has built the world's largest and most global network for on-demand production of customized items e.g. t-shirts, wall art, mugs, books, hoodies, and cards. We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs to sell their creativity globally, with a more local and sustainable production. With local production and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste, and carbon emissions are reduced.

We own no assets - we build the software that connects world-class production facilities all across the world. We have more than 130 production partners in 32 countries. In 72 hours we can reach more than 5 billion people with customized products in a smarter, faster, and greener way.

Gelato is changing the way that customized products can be produced on-demand. We are already empowering thousands of e-commerce entrepreneurs to grow and scale their businesses. With local production, and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste and carbon emissions are reduced.

Gelato consists of three different business units:

Optimalprint - our B2C e-commerce business, offering beautiful high-quality personalized products to consumers all over the world. The products are produced on-demand by Gelato’s local production network.

GelatoCreate - giving creators across the world instant access to a global market of customers. Simple integrations to webshops such as Shopify, Etsy and TikTok allow creators to connect and personalize their designs for a wide range of quality products, and Gelato takes care of the production and fulfillment through our local production.

GelatoConnect - the backbone of Gelato is enterprise software that powers the world's most advanced production on demand facilities, providing unmatched production workflow, logistics and procurement efficiency, quality management and cost savings.




What we are looking for

We are seeking analytics professionals with a passion for business impact to join our world class Finance & Strategy team. As a Data Analyst, you will help build strategic reports for investor and leadership teams and carry out analysis that will inform important financial and strategic decisions for Gelato. You will guide the finance team using data and insights by not simply presenting data, but telling data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your finance and strategy team members using clear insights and recommendations.

The position is based in Gelato’s offices in London (UK), Oslo (Norway), Stockholm (Sweden), and Madrid (Spain)

What you will be doing

Own the design, development, and maintenance of metrics, reports and dashboards to drive key business performance visibility for finance and strategy teams.
Identify trends & patterns using internal and external data sources powered with analytic models to provide actionable insights to business decision-makers.
Generate forecasts, recommendations, and strategic/tactical plans necessary to drive and influence business decision-making.
Share your knowledge and build creative solutions while helping the team evolve best practices.

Who you are

4 years+ of data analytics experience.
Strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and integrity in all your analyses
Good time management. You can handle multiple tasks, meeting deadlines without compromising quality.
Collaborative. You work well in a team environment, collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams.
Strong project and stakeholder management skills. You keep all stakeholders informed and manage expectations effectively.
Extensive hands-on experience in SQL.
Experience with data visualization and BI tools like Looker/Tableau/PowerBI.
Good knowledge of statistical analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with finance data or in finance related roles.
Advanced experience with Looker.
Experience in management consulting would be a plus.

What we offer

We offer you a chance to be part of a truly amazing journey in a company that sets very high targets and works hard to achieve them. You will be able to work with smart, motivated, and engaged co-workers from all over the world, in an intense and very energetic environment. This leads to you having a tangible impact on the way that we operate and expand our business.

Some of the highlights of the package include:

Strong technical culture of continuous innovation and improvement
Chance to become a shareholder of Gelato!
Flexible festive holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Work at one of our hub city offices or even remotely
And much much more!

What it’s like to work at Gelato

We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.

At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.

Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in English, regardless of which country you are applying from.

Title: Graduate Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Graduate Marketing Data Analyst at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like


Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards


What we are looking for in you?


A recent graduate with background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges


What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

🏠Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!

📚Personal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum

💰Annual compensation review

🏆Recognition rewards

🏝 Annual holiday leave

👶Parental Leave

🧑‍💼Employee Assistance Programme

🧳Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

✈️Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.


Show more

We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Graduate Marketing Data Analyst at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like

  • Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
  • Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
  • Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
  • Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
  • Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards

What we are looking for in you?

  • A recent graduate with background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
  • Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
  • Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
  • Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
  • Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
  • Excellent writing and communication skills
  • Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges

What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

🏠Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!

📚Personal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum

💰Annual compensation review

🏆Recognition rewards

🏝 Annual holiday leave

👶Parental Leave

🧑‍💼Employee Assistance Programme

🧳Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

✈️Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.







THE ROLE

As a Senior Data Analyst at Oetker Digital, you will play a critical role in owning and leveraging data to drive business decisions and strategies. You will work closely with various teams and business partners on the side of our Group companies to ask the right questions, deeply understand the business domains and processes, analyze datasets, generate insights and business cases based on data that help our brands grow and succeed in the digital space. Your expertise will guide the optimization of brand, marketing and sales strategies, product development, and customer engagement initiatives.







WHAT YOU'LL DO

Partner and collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their strategies, needs and objectives
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key business partners to ensure data solutions align with business goals
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Analyze datasets to extract actionable insights and support data-driven decision making
Develop and implement statistical models to solve complex business problems
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making
Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable insights through effective data storytelling







WHAT YOU'LL BRING

At least 5 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficiency in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Experience in Marketing Analytics & Optimization
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
You like to learn, work hands-on, take ownership, and have an impact
Fluent in German and English







WHAT WE OFFER

Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year’s Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child’s sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to €1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners







Diversity and Inclusion

At Oetker Digital, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion are crucial elements of a respectful and inspiring workplace. We value the unique experiences that each individual brings to our team, and we are committed to creating a culture where everyone feels valued.

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from candidates of all walks of life, backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Even if you don't meet all the requirements above, we actively encourage you to apply. We're eager to learn about the perspective you can bring to our team!

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Lockers
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

The Vinted Go Points domain at Vinted Go is responsible for expanding and maintaining points (parcel lockers & shops that act as pick-up and drop-off points) network for our logistics operations. As a Decision Scientist, you will play a crucial role in optimising locker data usage for analytical purposes, gathering insights, and improving user flows by defining success metrics, conducting A/B tests, and creating insightful dashboards. Your responsibilities include ensuring a comprehensive view of locker performance, enhancing maintenance visibility, performing anomaly detection, and analysing recurring issues. This role also offers the opportunity to develop future capabilities for auto-detecting potential problems and upcoming maintenance needs to proactively address locker performance and user experience challenges.

We have three distinct roles within Data Science & Analytics (DSA). We believe each role can make a similar business impact in different ways, and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision-making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identifying algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed optimally, and designing, developing, and maintaining production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.


In this position, you’ll


Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities, answer key business questions, improve, and maintain data products.
Analyse identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact.
Propose and implement key metrics that measure business performance, set up monitoring, and proactively flag issues.
Ensure requests are answered optimally (e.g., in the form of an ad hoc deep dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis).
Define the requirements for A/B testing and analyse the results of A/B tests.
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-service and dashboarding tools (Looker).
Closely collaborate with the product manager and help create a roadmap with prioritised hypotheses and analyses.


About You


Highly results-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes.
Strong communication skills, capable of presenting results to both technical and non-technical audiences convincingly.
Proficiency in dealing with technical challenges when building data products.
Entry to intermediate experience in the field of data analytics, typically 2+ years of work experience or equivalent proficiency.
Statistical proficiency, including A/B testing and regression analysis.
Fluent in SQL with practical experience in Python.
Experience with dashboarding tools such as Looker, Tableau, etc.
Advantageous: Experience collaborating with cross-functional product teams.
Advantageous: Background in logistics or e-commerce.


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 57,000 - € 77,100 gross per year.

  • 30 days of paid annual leave
  • Newest MacBook models
  • Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
  • Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture

  • A subsidised Deutschlandticket
  • The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 57,000 - € 77,100 gross per year.

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join our People Analytics Team. As Vinted grows with new products, locations and increasing complexity there is a need to further support decision making in the company with people data.

As a Senior Analyst your primary focus will be on analyzing and interpreting data across the employee lifecycle providing a holistic view from candidacy to alumni. You will have an opportunity to build People analytics products from scratch and shape the People Analytics function at Vinted. We’re looking for a special candidate that has a combination of HR domain expertise, strong knowledge of analysis tools and the ability to communicate well with a variety of stakeholders.

Reporting to People Analytics Lead you will work within a team whose mandate is to accelerate people analytics at Vinted. You will work with data across various People systems like Workday, Greenhouse, Peakon and others.

In this position, you’ll


Contribute to building People Analytics products and expansion of data-based culture
Understand business problems and enable business leaders and the People team to translate them into solutions supported by data and analysis
Managing dashboards, analysis and enabling for data spanning across the complete Employee Life Cycle (“From Hire to Retire”)
Contribute to cross-functional projects and initiatives in People team


About You


BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or another related field (or equivalent working experience)
HR domain expertise
Strong analytical, strategic, and storytelling skills
Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker but Tableau and Power Bi are applicable too
You are a Google Sheets master
Excellent communication and relationships building skills to partner with stakeholders
Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively
Knowledge of Workday reporting would be an advantage


Nice-to-have:


Hands-on experience in statistics and advanced analysis, i.e. hypothesis testing, forecasting, predictions, sentiment analysis, etc.
Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Matlab etc.)
Ability to use SQL
App scripting in Google Sheets


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 68,000 - € 92,000 gross per year.

Title: Data Analyst - Vendor Sales & Operations (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join the Vendor Sales & Operations - Data Team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

The sustainable acquisition of good quality restaurants is a crucial part of Delivery Hero’s profitability goal. We focus on: what to acquire, where, how should we prioritize the backlog of leads, what channel is better for us to prioritize investments on our side, how do we enhance the vendor experience in the onboarding process, etc.

We focus on global initiative, and our main stakeholders are global product and business teams that are also focused on restaurant acquisition.

Your Mission:


Owning end to end the analytics part on multiple projects for the Vendor management team (this can vary from Competitor intelligence, VRM, Grading, AMC)
We focus on delivering data projects and adding value with actionable insights that help the business and product teams


What you need to be successful

Your Heroic Skills


Passion for data, problem-solving and generating actionable insights that impact the business
Highly proficient in SQL
Proficient in Data visualization and storytelling
Team player and ability to think outside the box
Communication skills
Business understanding


Nice to have:


Experience with process orchestrators (preferably DBT+Airflow)
Experience in AB Testing
Practical experience working with Git (or similar version control system)


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join the Vendor Sales & Operations - Data Team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

The sustainable acquisition of good quality restaurants is a crucial part of Delivery Hero’s profitability goal. We focus on: what to acquire, where, how should we prioritize the backlog of leads, what channel is better for us to prioritize investments on our side, how do we enhance the vendor experience in the onboarding process, etc.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
CarOnSale is a start-up in the heart of Berlin. As a tech company, we have made it our mission to enable smooth digital processes in the automotive trade across Europe. Join us and develop new, innovative solutions for the B2B sector.

For our Data team based at our HQ in Berlin, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)

Your tasks:

Data Analysis:


Analyse and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights.
Identify opportunities for data-driven decision-making within the organisation.
Define and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success.



Project Leadership:


Lead data exploration projects to uncover actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and define data needs for various business initiatives.



Dashboard Creation:


Develop and maintain dashboards that enable stakeholders to monitor and analyse critical business metrics.



Report Generation:


Generate reports that provide valuable insights to support decision-making across multiple teams.



Stakeholder Management:


Engage with internal stakeholders to ensure their expectations align with our deliverables.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, setting clear expectations for scope and timeline.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and product managers.



Enablement:


Provide support to enhance daily reporting and analytics tasks within the company.
Offer training and education to team members on data analysis tools and techniques for better decision-making



Your profile


4+ years’ experience as a data analyst
Proven experience in data analysis, interpretation, and visualisation.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Tableau).
Experience working with Python.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects with attention to detail.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Familiarity with Google Analytics & tracking data
Fluency in English (C1)



Nice to have:


Being able to communicate in German



Why COS?


First things first: You’ll be taken seriously from day one and will play an important role in our mission, because we want to disrupt Europe’s automotive market together with you
Growth and development: benefit from a detailed on-boarding program, systematic feedback cycles and individual coaching
Your gear, your choice: you will be provided with a MacBook or Windows laptop and all the hardware and software you need to work
Become a COSie: be part of a motivated team with ambitious goals and enjoy lots of fun, lots of awesome team events and a unique COS team spirit
Truly diverse and inclusive: Diversity is important to you? It is important to us too! Diversity in which everyone feels comfortable, is absolutely central to us

Title: Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music publisher worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.

BMG’s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. We’re transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.

We are currently seeking an experienced Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. As a seasoned Data Analyst, you will guide junior analysts and collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!

 

What You’ll Be Doing


Process big data volumes, modeling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (e.g. Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs
Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Finance)
Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business
Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products
Interact with developers, data engineers, and management to propose new technologies, processes and system improvements, as well as global data governance strategies
Provide training and mentorship to junior team members, empowering them to excel in their contributions to the team’s projects
Develop sustainable processes and methodologies to support the effectiveness of our Data Analytics function


What You Bring


Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python
Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau
Broad understanding of data analysis methods and storytelling
Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
Strong interest to mentor junior colleagues with enthusiasm and expertise
Capability to plan and implement projects independently
Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment


It’s also a plus if you have…


Team leadership experience
Prior music industry experience
Experience with GCP, dbt and Git
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
Understanding of statistical methods and ML
Experience using ETL frameworks


What We Offer


A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work.
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees.
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters.
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team.


This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

Title: Data Analysis Lead (m/f/d)
Description:
Everything we do, starts with you. Together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. To enable everyone’s future financial growth.




We are looking for a

Data Analysis Lead (m/f/d)

(unlimited, fulltime) Join our team at our location in Verl, Berlin, Baden-Baden, Oslo or Heerenveen – flexible working conditions available




As the Data Analysis Lead, you will guide our international team of data analysts across the Nordics, Benelux, and DACH regions. You will play a crucial role in advancing our data strategy and developing our team to meet their professional growth goals. Collaborating closely with various business and functional units, you will translate business needs into data experiments and derive actionable insights about our consumers, clients, and business processes.







Your responsibilities:

Lead, mentor, and manage an international team of data analysts within the fintech domain
Foster a collaborative and high-performance team environment, promoting continuous improvement and innovation
Conduct complex data analyses and provide actionable insights to support business goals and strategic initiatives
Ensure accuracy, integrity, and timeliness of all analytical deliverables, maintaining high data quality standards
Develop and maintain analysis and visualizations to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders using data storytelling techniques
Oversee the planning, execution, and completion of data analysis projects, ensuring alignment with business objectives and deadlines
Collaborate with stakeholders from various business units (e.g., BNPL, collections) and functional units (e.g., Finance, Marketing, Risk Management) to understand data needs and deliver insights
Provide decision support to business units, aiding in informed, data-driven decision-making
Standardize data analysis methodologies, implementing best practices to ensure consistency across the team
Contribute to data governance and strategy initiatives, supporting the organization’s data management and strategic goals




What you should bring:

5+ years of data analysis experience, including 2 years in a leadership role
Master’s/MBA degree in a numerate subject (e.g., Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics)
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (Databricks, SQL, Python)
Excellent analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy, able to identify issues and conduct necessary analysis
Exceptional interpersonal and leadership skills, with a passion for enabling team growth
Ability to balance multiple priorities, work independently, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Experience in the financial industry, especially in Debt Collection and Buy Now, Pay Later
Working experience in an agile, cross-functional organizational setup
Team player, hands-on mentality, and result-oriented







Thrive at Riverty with great benefits:

Enjoy an open, trusting culture in agile teams and access opportunities within the Bertelsmann Group.
Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
Grow together through Riverty Academy trainings and personalized development.
Feel valued with numerous employee discounts.
Our flexible working arrangements empower you to blend on-site collaboration with remote work, tailoring your professional experience to suit your lifestyle.

This list doesn't assure any certain benefits or actions. They might depend on the country or contract details and can change anytime without prior notice. We are happy to discuss these benefits further during your interview.




About us

We are Riverty. And we believe everyone should be in control of their financials. We ask you to join in. Because together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. We build on experience of more than 50 years. More than 5,000 people in 13 countries drive our company and contribution to society. And we have their backs. We make sure they feel supported and included: Across teams, across physical and invisible borders and across the globe.




Our world is growing. And we’re here. Together, we’re finding smarter, simpler, seamlessly connected ways to manage money. By leveraging data and financial technology, our holistic solutions provide flexible payments, smarter accounting, and fair debt collection, all aimed at fostering everyone's financial growth.




And. Everything we do, starts with you. Join us and let‘s build a more sustainable financial future, together.




More information on riverty.com/careers. Are you already convinced? Then we look forward to receiving your online application – with just a few clicks.

We look forward to applications from candidates who contribute to the diversity of our company. We relate diversity in particular to the dimensions of cultural or social origin, religion, age, disability, gender and sexual identity.
