Title: Staff/Principal Data Analyst (d/f/m)
Description:
The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be office-based, hybrid, or fully remote from one of the following countries: Germany, Spain, Ireland, the Netherlands, or the UK.

Drive Strategic Decisions. Shape Our Future. The Data Department is on a mission to facilitate better decisions within the company. We build core data products and enable internal teams to create and share their own. Join our team and help us build the foundation of data at Personio.

As a Staff/Principal Data Analyst supporting the Finance, Legal, and Strategy (FLS) team at Personio, you play a pivotal role in transforming data into strategic insights, shaping our company’s financial strategy. In this role, you're not just analyzing numbers; you're driving critical business decisions and influencing long-term strategies. Your insights directly impact our financial health and strategic direction, making your contribution vital to our mission of sustainable growth and operational excellence.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Business Partnership: Act as a primary data strategist for the organization, partnering with top executives. Regularly consult with the CFO and other executives, providing data-driven guidance on major strategic initiatives and long-term planning.
Data Analysis: Analyze and interpret diverse datasets, focusing on financial performance, legal trends, and strategic initiatives to guide FLS in making informed, data-driven decisions.
Dashboard Development: Create and strategize the evolution of real-time, interactive dashboards for stakeholders, ensuring they are user-friendly and aligned with the evolving needs of the business.
Business Reviews and Insight Generation: Oversee the insight generation process for business reviews at a company-wide level, guiding analysts in different departments to highlight crucial insights and trends.
Strategic Planning: Collaborate with leadership and peers in developing business strategies grounded in data insights, aimed at growth, operational optimization, and cost reduction.
Stakeholder Management: Lead multiple projects simultaneously, managing expectations and collaborating with the data team for internal consistency, scalability, and reliability of data practices.
Proactive Team Embedding: Act as a strategic data partner for multiple teams, guiding them in aligning their objectives with data insights. Lead initiatives to use data in solving complex business challenges.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Education & Experience: A quantitative degree (e.g., Applied Math, Econ, Stats, Eng, CS) paired with a minimum of 7 years of data analytics experience, in a SaaS, Subscription, or B2B environment with a focus on Finance, Legal, and Strategy. Experience working with executive-level stakeholders (CFO, CEO, …).
Deep understanding of SaaS-specific financial processes and financial systems like Salesforce, Chargebee, Adaptive.
KPI and Dashboard Expertise: Strong understanding of financial and strategic KPIs and proficient in creating scalable dashboards that effectively translate business requirements into impactful visuals.
Technical Proficiency: Advanced skills in SQL and BI/Visualization tools like Tableau, facilitating data extraction, manipulation, and presentation.
Statistical Knowledge: Master the use of cutting-edge statistical methods and tools, providing strategic guidance and recommendations based on sophisticated data analysis.
Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve deep into data, identifying underlying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to articulate complex data observations in simple terms, ensuring clarity and understanding among stakeholders. Master the art of storytelling with data, driving organizational change and strategy through powerful presentations and reports.
Entrepreneurial Approach: A proactive problem-solver, focused on generating impactful results and identifying opportunities for improvement through data-driven insights.


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Benefits

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package – reevaluated each year – that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years (because we love what we do, but we also love vacation!)
Make an impact on the environment and society with 2 (fully paid) Impact Days – one for an individual project of your choice and one for a company-wide initiative
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities with PersonioCares
Find your best way to work with our office-led, remote-friendly PersonioFlex! Most teams offer a roughly 50% remote, 50% in-office working framework
Invest in your development with an annual personal development budget to use on professional memberships, external certifications, conferences, and more
Connect with your fellow Personios at regular company and team events like All Company Culture Week and local year-end celebrations
Engage in a high-impact working environment with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes


About Us

Bring your best. Make your mark. We’re using technology to revolutionize the way HR operates so that we can transform the way millions of people experience work every day. We move fast, challenge the status quo, and support our people as they shape their careers.

With over 10,000 customers and a team of 2,000 in eight offices around the world, now is the perfect time to join! We believe in hiring driven people who want to make an impact. So bring your best, and let’s build the future of HR technology together.

Discover our Personio Principles, that guide our mindset, behaviours, and the ways we work together:

Exceed Customer Expectations: We anticipate, prioritize, and solve for the needs of our customers.

Deliver Exceptional Results: We dream big and move with urgency to make great things happen.

Elevate One Another: We work together as trusted partners to amplify our collective impact.

Care to Challenge: We care personally and challenge directly to unlock our full potential.

Ignite Positive Momentum: We embrace the challenge with a positive mindset and celebrate our wins together.
Show more
HTML:
The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be office-based, hybrid, or fully remote from one of the following countries: Germany, Spain, Ireland, the Netherlands, or the UK.

Drive Strategic Decisions. Shape Our Future. The Data Department is on a mission to facilitate better decisions within the company. We build core data products and enable internal teams to create and share their own. Join our team and help us build the foundation of data at Personio.

As a Staff/Principal Data Analyst supporting the Finance, Legal, and Strategy (FLS) team at Personio, you play a pivotal role in transforming data into strategic insights, shaping our company’s financial strategy. In this role, you're not just analyzing numbers; you're driving critical business decisions and influencing long-term strategies. Your insights directly impact our financial health and strategic direction, making your contribution vital to our mission of sustainable growth and operational excellence.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do

  • Strategic Business Partnership: Act as a primary data strategist for the organization, partnering with top executives. Regularly consult with the CFO and other executives, providing data-driven guidance on major strategic initiatives and long-term planning.
  • Data Analysis: Analyze and interpret diverse datasets, focusing on financial performance, legal trends, and strategic initiatives to guide FLS in making informed, data-driven decisions.
  • Dashboard Development: Create and strategize the evolution of real-time, interactive dashboards for stakeholders, ensuring they are user-friendly and aligned with the evolving needs of the business.
  • Business Reviews and Insight Generation: Oversee the insight generation process for business reviews at a company-wide level, guiding analysts in different departments to highlight crucial insights and trends.
  • Strategic Planning: Collaborate with leadership and peers in developing business strategies grounded in data insights, aimed at growth, operational optimization, and cost reduction.
  • Stakeholder Management: Lead multiple projects simultaneously, managing expectations and collaborating with the data team for internal consistency, scalability, and reliability of data practices.
  • Proactive Team Embedding: Act as a strategic data partner for multiple teams, guiding them in aligning their objectives with data insights. Lead initiatives to use data in solving complex business challenges.

Role Requirements: What you need to succeed

  • Education & Experience: A quantitative degree (e.g., Applied Math, Econ, Stats, Eng, CS) paired with a minimum of 7 years of data analytics experience, in a SaaS, Subscription, or B2B environment with a focus on Finance, Legal, and Strategy. Experience working with executive-level stakeholders (CFO, CEO, …).
  • Deep understanding of SaaS-specific financial processes and financial systems like Salesforce, Chargebee, Adaptive.
  • KPI and Dashboard Expertise: Strong understanding of financial and strategic KPIs and proficient in creating scalable dashboards that effectively translate business requirements into impactful visuals.
  • Technical Proficiency: Advanced skills in SQL and BI/Visualization tools like Tableau, facilitating data extraction, manipulation, and presentation.
  • Statistical Knowledge: Master the use of cutting-edge statistical methods and tools, providing strategic guidance and recommendations based on sophisticated data analysis.
  • Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve deep into data, identifying underlying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
  • Communication Skills: Ability to articulate complex data observations in simple terms, ensuring clarity and understanding among stakeholders. Master the art of storytelling with data, driving organizational change and strategy through powerful presentations and reports.
  • Entrepreneurial Approach: A proactive problem-solver, focused on generating impactful results and identifying opportunities for improvement through data-driven insights.

Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Benefits

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:

  • Receive a competitive reward package – reevaluated each year – that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
  • Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years (because we love what we do, but we also love vacation!)
  • Make an impact on the environment and society with 2 (fully paid) Impact Days – one for an individual project of your choice and one for a company-wide initiative
  • Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities with PersonioCares
  • Find your best way to work with our office-led, remote-friendly PersonioFlex! Most teams offer a roughly 50% remote, 50% in-office working framework
  • Invest in your development with an annual personal development budget to use on professional memberships, external certifications, conferences, and more
  • Connect with your fellow Personios at regular company and team events like All Company Culture Week and local year-end celebrations
  • Engage in a high-impact working environment with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes

About Us

Bring your best. Make your mark. We’re using technology to revolutionize the way HR operates so that we can transform the way millions of people experience work every day. We move fast, challenge the status quo, and support our people as they shape their careers.

With over 10,000 customers and a team of 2,000 in eight offices around the world, now is the perfect time to join! We believe in hiring driven people who want to make an impact. So bring your best, and let’s build the future of HR technology together.

Discover our Personio Principles, that guide our mindset, behaviours, and the ways we work together:

Exceed Customer Expectations: We anticipate, prioritize, and solve for the needs of our customers.

Deliver Exceptional Results: We dream big and move with urgency to make great things happen.

Elevate One Another: We work together as trusted partners to amplify our collective impact.

Care to Challenge: We care personally and challenge directly to unlock our full potential.

Ignite Positive Momentum: We embrace the challenge with a positive mindset and celebrate our wins together.

Title: (Junior) Consultant Data Analytics (m/w/d)
Description:
Deine Benefits
Corporate Benefits: Dazu zählen beispielsweise WellYou Gesundheitsbudget, JobRad-Leasing oder Firmenfitness mit EGYM Wellpass
Flexibles Arbeiten: Deine Pläne sind so individuell wie du selbst: Wähle deinen Arbeitsort flexibel – ob beim Kunden, in einer unserer Office Locations oder remote
Mentorship: Erfahrene Kolleg:innen stehen dir bei deinem Start und deiner Entwicklung zur Seite
Persönliche Weiterentwicklung: Dich erwarten vielfältige Karriereperspektiven in einem unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag sowie individuelle Förderung durch ein umfangreiches Trainings- und Coachingangebot
Teamspirit: Bei uns werden flache Hierarchien und eine teamorientierte Unternehmenskultur gelebt – darüber hinaus sind ökologische Verantwortung und gesellschaftliches Engagement Teil unserer DNA
Vertrauensurlaub: Unser innovatives Konzept ermöglicht es dir, deine Erholungszeiten in Abstimmung mit deinem Team eigenverantwortlich und selbstbestimmt festzulegen
Vergütungsmodell: Du profitierst von unserem attraktiven Modell inklusive eines erfolgsabhängigen Bonus
Work-Life-Choice: Wir bieten dir hierzu umfangreiche Angebote – dazu zählen u. a. Sabbaticals oder Workation




Deine zukünftigen Aufgaben

Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir dich als (Junior) Consultant Data Analytics (m/w/d) an den Standorten Berlin, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt am Main, Hamburg, Leipzig, München, Stuttgart und Walldorf.

Unsere Kunden digitalisieren kontinuierlich ihre Reporting-Prozesse und Data Analytics Landschaft. Gemeinsam mit unserem erfahrenen Team unterstützt du beim Aufbau von innovativen Reporting & Analytics-Systemen, Data Analytics Plattformen oder Data Management Konzepten. In den Bereichen Automotive, Mobility, Maschinen- & Anlagenbau, Logistik & Distribution, Konsumgüter & Handel, Chemie und Pharma gestaltest du mit unseren Kunden die digitale Zukunft:

Du bearbeitest spannende Consulting-Themen wie Analytics-Strategie, oder die Konzeption und Realisierung von State-of-the Art Cloud-, AI- oder Analytics-Applikationen
Du berätst unsere Kunden bei der Einführung von Data Mesh, Data Fabric, Data Virtualization oder Datenkatalogen
Du lernst in einem sehr erfahrenen Team modernste Data Analytics Produkte wie AZURE, AWS, Snowflake, Databricks, SAP Datasphere oder Google Cloud Platform zu implementieren
Du entwickelst Management Dashboards in Power BI, Tableau, Qlik oder SAP Analytics Cloud

Dein Profil
Dein Studium der Wirtschaftswissenschaften, des Wirtschaftsingenieurwesens, der Wirtschaftsinformatik oder ähnlichem hast du erfolgreich absolviert
Du konntest bereits erste praktische Erfahrungen im Bereich  Data Analytics, Data Warehousing, ETL Prozessen (SQL) oder Datenmodellierung sammeln
Idealerweise verfügst du schon über Branchenerfahrung in den Industrien Automotive, Mobility, Maschinen- und Anlagenbau, Logistik & Distribution, Konsumgüterindustrie & Handel oder Chemie & Pharma
Um unsere Kunden vor Ort optimal zu beraten, bist du bist bereit, national und international zu reisen
Sehr gute deutsche und englische Sprachkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab




Together, we are more than Business

BearingPoint ist eine unabhängige Management- und Technologieberatung mit europäischen Wurzeln und globaler Reichweite. Wir bieten Beratung, die Strategie mit Technologie vereint und verbinden Unternehmertum mit Innovationsgeist.
Du machst den Unterschied: Wir geben dir den Raum, du selbst zu sein und dein volles Potenzial zu entfalten. Unabhängig davon, woher du kommst, woran du glaubst oder wen du liebst. Wir stehen ein für Chancengleichheit und Vielfalt. Denn wir sind überzeugt, dass erst Facettenreichtum zu einem starken Miteinander, originellen Ideen und echter Innovation führt. Deshalb sind unsere Teams bunt. Und sie dürfen bunter werden. Perspektivenwechsel statt Stagnation – moving forward mit BearingPoint. Zeig, wer du bist, und engagiere dich als Teil des Teams in einer unserer internen Initiativen: Women@BearingPoint, Proud@BearingPoint, Ability@BearingPoint & More@BearingPoint.

Show more

Title: Working Student – Power Platform / BI data analyst
Description:
Company Statement

The new sustainability: want to join a renewable energy pioneer? Our mission is to advance large-scale photovoltaic to meet the growing global demand for clean electricity. Come be a part of our success story!

Intro Paragraph

The Working Student – Power BI Data Analyst will assist in transforming data into insightful and actionable visualizations. By supporting the design and updating of interactive dashboards in Power BI, optimizing data workflows, and extracting data through SQL queries, this role contributes to data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Your Job


Dashboard Creation & Updates: Design and create interactive automated data dashboards using Power BI. Update existing dashboards with new data and visualizations
Data Workflow Optimization: Design and implement improvements to ETL processes for smoother data ingestion into the dashboards
SQL Queries: Extract necessary data from SQL databases using well-written queries
UI dashboard Enhancements: Suggest and implement changes to create a user friendly Power BI dashboard and improve the overall usability
Stakeholder Communication: Follow-up and communicate updates, reports, and answer questions regarding the dashboards
(Bonus) Data Analysis: Conduct analysis using Python and Pandas for additional support and insights is a plus


Your profile


Currently enrolled in a program in the following fields: (e.g., Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or similar)
Solid understanding of Power BI: dashboard creation, DAX, and visualization techniques
Experience with SQL and relational databases
Familiarity with data workflow/ETL concepts
Familiarity with other Microsoft power platform tools, such as Power automate, power app and co-pilot studio
Python and Pandas skills
Basic knowledge of UI/UX principles
Strong attention to detail and data accuracy
Excellent communication and organizational skills


We offer you


A truly international work environment with colleagues from around the world
An open-minded and highly motivated team
Interesting and challenging tasks and an opportunity to experience working with our global projects
We encourage both teamwork and personal responsibility
Great opportunities for professional and personal growth


About Us

ib vogt is firmly committed to supporting the decarbonisation of the global electricity sector. The company focuses on the global development of turnkey PV plants and battery storage projects as well as the expansion of its IPP portfolio. In these areas, the company performs all integral services of the value chain from development, financing, and EPC, to O&M and asset management.

Headquartered in Berlin, Germany, ib vogt has established various offices across Europe, Asia Pacific, the Americas, and Africa as part of its presence in over 40 countries. The company works together with numerous partners globally, augmenting its in-house team of over 900 staff. ib vogt has built or has in construction more than 4 GW of PV power plants globally with a project pipeline of more than 60 GWp.

Title: Senior Growth Data Analyst
Description:
The role

As a Growth Data Analyst in the Growth Analytics team, you will join the wider International Marketing Analytics group which acts as a key consultant for the International part of HelloFresh business. Your main focus will be on supporting your Growth stakeholders in their decision making, and you will be their key contact person regarding data and analytics questions. Your experience with Growth analytics and related technologies, together with your excellent communication, stakeholder management and organizational skills will have a big impact on the company’s performance.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don’t “tick all the boxes” but think you’d thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You’ll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize marketing campaigns and channel targeting and efficiency
Translate business questions into meaningful analytics for your stakeholders via multiple Growth channels
Creating ad-hoc insights, Lift Tests, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilise various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Growth Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
You will not only take responsibility of own projects, but also be a team player to collaborate and share knowledge with other analysts


What You’ll Bring


Proven experience in Growth Marketing Analytics or any of the following domains: Data Analytics/Business Analytics/Marketing Analytics/Product Analytics/Data Science
4+ years of experience in data analytics and statistical modelling
A degree in Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
Preferably experience in working with web analytics (Google Analytics, Meta AA, ADH etc.)
Preferably experience with growth marketing analytics and testing (lift tests, campaign analytics, channel efficiency, AB testing)
Expertise in SQL, Python & bigquery with excitement to learn more on the technical side!
Expertise in building dashboards, we use Tableau
Experience in statistical modeling, regression, clustering, time series etc is good to have
Any team management experience, mentoring or managing 1-2 analyst is good to have
Experience in performing analysis with large datasets and knowing what the common pitfalls are
Marketing or product related experience is good, not a must
Analytical and critical thinking combined with good presentation and communication skills
Strong problems solving skills and hands-on & can-do attitude
Ability to work independently


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Comprehensive relocation assistance to move to Berlin plus visa application support (if applicable)
A significant discount on your weekly HelloFresh box
Internal learning and development opportunities with the HelloFresh Academy
Mental health support, including Headspace subscription and access to qualified therapists through Spill
Monthly transportation budget through Rydes app
Working parents support
Additional perks include: Annual German language budget, discounts for John Reed gyms & Urban Sports Club, regular company events, fresh fruit & free drinks in the office, in-house yoga classes, monthly discount on the Convini vending machine in the office
Hybrid working model (option to work from home for up to 2 days per week if preferred)
Sabbatical leave option after 18 months of being with HelloFresh
HelloFresh Pension Scheme that is subsidized with 20% on top
A diverse and vibrant international environment of 90+ different nationalities
The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

JR100987

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Senior Marketing Data Analyst

Berlin/Remote

€70,000 to €90,000 (including bonus)+ Holiday + Benefit




Excellent opportunity to join a start-up in the entertainment and gaming sector changing the way users are able to consume content.




This company produces a platform which allows mobile games to be accessed by users while inspiring their loyalty through innovative features.




In this role you will a key role in building a reliable foundation for user acquisition data and help the UA team achieve company goals. This role involves validating and analysing the results of user acquisition efforts and providing valuable insights to improve performance. ?This is a great opportunity for any data analyst to take the lead in deep data analysis, identify growth opportunities, and ensure data accuracy.




The ideal candidate will be experienced in fast-paced B2C environments ideally within the mobile apps sector. You will have experience using SQL and Python and data visualization tools including Looker, Metabase and Tableau. Also with an in depth understanding of digital marketing strategies, as well as technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms




This is a fantastic opportunity to have a role where you can take ownership of projects working with a high degree of autonomy creating the long-term strategy of the product.




The Role:

Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends.
Develop and maintain data visualization dashboards.
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Facebook, and TikTok.
Manage user LTV prediction tools, ensuring the LTV model’s reliability and data accuracy.
Research and revise the CPE targeting strategy for UA channels, and design the event implementation flow within our apps.
Develop UA alerts and reports automation.
Design and manage UA spend and revenue planning tools, and assist in setting goals for the UA team.
Manage MMP tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations.




The Person:

You have a Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in a similar role.
You have proficiency with data analysis tools and programming languages, such as SQL, Python, etc. and data visualization tools (Looker, Metabase, Tableau)
You have a strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry and concrete experience with most major mobile marketing channels such Meta, Applovin, Google Ads or Unity and other networks / DSPs.
You have experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase etc.
You have in-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well as technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms.




Reference Number: BBBH231059




To apply for this role or to be considered for further roles, please click "Apply Now" or contact Alexandra House at Rise Technical Recruitment.




Rise Technical Recruitment GmbH acts an employment agency for permanent roles and an employment business for temporary roles.




The salary advertised is the bracket available for this position. The actual salary paid will be dependent on your level of experience, qualifications and skill set. We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitable candidates.

Show more
HTML:
Senior Marketing Data Analyst

Berlin/Remote

€70,000 to €90,000 (including bonus)+ Holiday + Benefit


Excellent opportunity to join a start-up in the entertainment and gaming sector changing the way users are able to consume content.


This company produces a platform which allows mobile games to be accessed by users while inspiring their loyalty through innovative features.


In this role you will a key role in building a reliable foundation for user acquisition data and help the UA team achieve company goals. This role involves validating and analysing the results of user acquisition efforts and providing valuable insights to improve performance. ?This is a great opportunity for any data analyst to take the lead in deep data analysis, identify growth opportunities, and ensure data accuracy.


The ideal candidate will be experienced in fast-paced B2C environments ideally within the mobile apps sector. You will have experience using SQL and Python and data visualization tools including Looker, Metabase and Tableau. Also with an in depth understanding of digital marketing strategies, as well as technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms


This is a fantastic opportunity to have a role where you can take ownership of projects working with a high degree of autonomy creating the long-term strategy of the product.


The Role:

  • Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends.
  • Develop and maintain data visualization dashboards.
  • Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Facebook, and TikTok.
  • Manage user LTV prediction tools, ensuring the LTV model’s reliability and data accuracy.
  • Research and revise the CPE targeting strategy for UA channels, and design the event implementation flow within our apps.
  • Develop UA alerts and reports automation.
  • Design and manage UA spend and revenue planning tools, and assist in setting goals for the UA team.
  • Manage MMP tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations.


The Person:

  • You have a Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
  • 3+ years of experience in a similar role.
  • You have proficiency with data analysis tools and programming languages, such as SQL, Python, etc. and data visualization tools (Looker, Metabase, Tableau)
  • You have a strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry and concrete experience with most major mobile marketing channels such Meta, Applovin, Google Ads or Unity and other networks / DSPs.
  • You have experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase etc.
  • You have in-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well as technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms.


Reference Number: BBBH231059


To apply for this role or to be considered for further roles, please click "Apply Now" or contact Alexandra House at Rise Technical Recruitment.


Rise Technical Recruitment GmbH acts an employment agency for permanent roles and an employment business for temporary roles.


The salary advertised is the bracket available for this position. The actual salary paid will be dependent on your level of experience, qualifications and skill set. We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitable candidates.

Title: Junior Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
For our headquarters in Berlin Prenzlauer-Berg, we are looking to have you on-board as our new:

Junior Data Engineer (m/f/d)




Our Data Platform team enables data-driven decision-making at home24 and our partners by developing impactful data products with end-to-end responsibility from data integration to dashboards and data science applications. As part of our growing team, you'll work on an exciting new project, making it an ideal time to welcome you to our team.




Your Responsibilities

Collaborate with your team members to design, implement and maintain data processing pipelines in different clouds (AWS and Azure)
Assist in defining the vision and objectives for data products by working closely with product managers, analysts, and other team members
Support analysts in developing high-performing and insightful dashboards by providing necessary data infrastructure
Implement automated monitoring tools to ensure data accuracy and reliability
Engage proactively with cross-functional teams to identify and implement pragmatic solutions to business problems
Contribute to the continuous improvement of data engineering processes and best practices




Your Profile

If you're interested in the role, but don't meet every requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We value a willingness to learn and grow with us. Tell us why you’re the right person in your application.

University degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or a related area
First experience working on projects using Python or Scala with data processing frameworks
Understanding of SQL
A passion for emerging technologies
Understanding of data modeling concepts
Experience with the AWS or Azure clouds
Experience in e-commerce is a plus




What We Offer You

Your impact

The chance to make an impact in a highly motivated team of professionals
An open-minded culture ready to incorporate new and creative ideas

Your growth

Mentoring and support from experienced colleagues
Extensive learning opportunities from our home24 academy and external partners
Room for growth and development within your role through regular feedback rounds

Your path

Hybrid working model: you have the flexibility to work from home on Wednesdays and Fridays in our standard working mode. We are in the office together Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays
The possibility to work up to two months per year within Germany or from an EU country
Up to 30 days paid vacation each year to unwind and recharge
City mobility with a subsidized public transportation ticket and our eco-friendly bike leasing program #ridinghome

Your second home

International campus in the heart of Berlin featuring drive-in bicycle garage, outdoor space and lounge areas, fitness facilities, parent and multi-faith rooms close to the Berlin S-Bahn train station Landsberger Allee
Company benefits including a pension scheme, 30 % off the home24 assortment, and employee discounts at partner organizations
You want to learn more about our home24 company culture and what it is like to be a homie? Follow @teamhome24 on Instagram




If you want to become part of a thrilling success story – we are looking forward to your application. Please send us your resume, cover letter and all relevant documents together with your salary expectations and the earliest possible starting date via our career site.




Your home is surely filled with furniture of varying materials and styles. The same is true for home24 as an employer. We celebrate the diversity of the people who work with us. Be who you are and feel welcome to #makeyourselfathome24




You can find all job offers on our career site !




home24 SE | Otto-Ostrowski-Straße 3 | 10249 Berlin | Contact: Nadine Scharf

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Benefits




· Work up to 20 hours per week.

· Earn a competitive rate of pay.

· Develop your research skills.

· Avoid the long commute.

· Work from the comfort of your home office.

· Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Apply Online Today!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Was du bei uns machst

Die Analyse und Strukturierung von Daten lässt dein Herz höher schlagen? Außerdem behälst du den Blick aufs große Ganze und weißt genau welche strategischen Empfehlungen den Kunden glücklich machen? Wenn du dazu noch eine Leidenschaft für Werbung hast und dich in einem lebendigen und kreativen Umfeld weiterentwickeln möchtest, bist du bei uns genau richtig!


Entwicklung und Pflege von Dashboards
Entwicklung und Erstellung von Reportings für Kunden
Erstellung von Audiences und Insights als Basis für Strategieausarbeitungen
Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen
Unterstützung bei der Erarbeitung von Kanalstrategien und strategischen Empfehlungen für Kunden im Bereich Datenanalyse/Reporting
Unterstützung der Kolleg*innen bei der Interpretation von Daten
Aufbau und Vorantreiben der Dateninfrastruktur des Teams


Was du mitbringst


Du hast bereits Berufserfahrung im Bereich Social Media in einer digitalen Agentur mit dem Schwerpunkt Datenanalyse gesammelt (Performance Agentur, Mediaagentur)
Du bringst Kenntnisse in der Social Media Analyse von Tools mit (zB Facebook Business Manager, Twitter Analytics, Instagram Analytics, Emplifi etc.), sowie Kenntnisse in der Visualisierung von Tools und Datenbanken (zB Tableau, Looker Studio, Power BI, IBM Kognos / SQL, MS SQL, P SQL)
Du hast bereits fundierte Erfahrung mit Web- und Marketing Analytics (zB Google Analytics, SAS, Salesforce, Adobe, Microsoft etc.)
Du besitzt fachliches Know How in Global Web Index oder Best4Planning
Besonders deine Erfahrungen mit Looker Studio und Supermetrics bringst du erfolgreich bei uns ein
Du besitzt die Fähigkeit Social Media KPIs und ihre Abhängigkeit zu verstehen (Paid und Organic) sowie das Verständnis, Erkenntnis in ansprechende und verständliche Darstellungen zu übertragen
Durch dein Verständnis für Prozesse der Social Media Datenerhebung und Darstellung bereicherst du das gesamte Team (Benchmarking, Index-Berechnung, Mittelwert, Lineare Regression, Box Plot und Skalenniveaus)


Wer wir sind

Gegründet 1981 in Hamburg, sind wir als eine der führenden Kreativ-Agenturen im deutschsprachigen Raum mittlerweile mit Standorten in Berlin, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt, Stuttgart, Zürich, Wien und Brüssel vertreten. Bei uns arbeiten rund 1.200 Kolleg*innen – wir nennen sie Friends – mit Leidenschaft und Kreativität für große und kleine Kunden aus allen Branchen.

Wie wir unsere Friendskultur leben

Alle Friends haben bei uns den Raum, sie selbst zu sein, zu lernen und zu wachsen. Du kannst innovative Ideen einbringen und groß werden lassen. Auf dich warten neue Herausforderungen und vielfältige Weiterbildungsangebote. Im Mittelpunkt stehen immer die Menschen und ein wertschätzendes Miteinander. Daher sind Vielfalt, Gleichberechtigung und Inklusion wesentlich in unserer Wertekultur und Managementstrategie. In unserer Academy und mit unseren Angeboten setzen wir auf Mental Health, Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf sowie einen großen Fokus auf Diversity-Impulse in Unconscious-Bias-Workshops, in Vorträgen oder innerhalb verschiedener Mitarbeitendennetzwerke (ERGs).

Was es oben drauf gibt


Wir ermöglichen ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell (zwei Office-Tage) und flexible Arbeitszeiten
Arbeiten aus dem EU-Ausland | bis zu 45 Tage
Discounts bei Dienstleistern und Fitnessstudios im Umkreis unserer Standorte
Vergünstigter Paketpreis von "Wellhub" für Sport-, Freizeit-, Wellness- oder App-Angebote
Möglichkeit der Mitgestaltung der Agenturkultur durch Round Tables und Mitarbeitendeninitiativen, wie z. B. unserer &Queer*-Community
Scholz & Friends Academy: offene Weiterbildungsangebote zu Fachthemen, Impulsgebungen, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging (D.E.I.B.) und vielem mehr
Mental-Health-Support in Kooperation mit unseren Partner*innen von Telus Health: u.a. Videositzungen mit Therapeut*innen und Psycholog*innen, zur Förderung der individuellen mentalen Gesundheit
Eltern-Kind-Service zur Förderung des familienfreundlichen Klimas am Arbeitsplatz und eine gesunde Work-Life-Balance mit unseren Partner*innen von voiio


Weitere Benefits an deinem Standort erfährst du im persönlichen Gespräch!

Verrate uns gerne, wie du angesprochen werden möchtest (Wunschname und Pronomen). Dann können wir dies im gesamten Prozess berücksichtigen.

 

Du willst vor deiner Bewerbung noch ein wenig mehr über uns erfahren oder hast Fragen zu Barrierefreiheit bei Scholz & Friends? Kein Problem! Schreib uns einfach eine Mail unter jobs@s-f.com. Wir freuen uns auf dich!

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Business Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Business Analytics and will see you collaborate primarily with the Supply Tech Team to improve supplier engagement and, in turn increase the inventory available on the marketplace for our travellers

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategy
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports
Serve as a liaison between the product teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg: pandas, scikit-learn)
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus
Experience working in Marketplace business
Experience solving Marketplace operations questions, such as understanding inventory diversity.
Experience in statistical modelling.
Experience in B2B product analytics.


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Associate Data Warehouse Engineer
Description:
Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 700 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are Activism, Transparency, Dedication and Greatness and Collective. We are proud to be a BCorp.

About The Job
We are seeking a motivated Junior Data Warehouse Engineer to join our Analytics Engineering team in Berlin. This role focuses on supporting and maintaining our Cloud Data Warehouse solution, primarily using Snowflake. The ideal candidate will have a growth mindset, be eager to learn new technologies, and assist in building data solutions to improve automation, efficiency, scalability, and data availability across the organization.

What You'll Do


Assist in designing and managing Snowflake database architectures
Engage in CI/CD processes to streamline and automate development workflows
Contribute to and maintain DBT (data build tool) configurations and deployments
Explore and analyze database engine mechanics to enhance performance
Troubleshoot database-related issues with a detail-oriented approach





Who You Are


Recent graduate with a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Strong interest in database technologies, particularly Snowflake
Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and their applications
Familiarity with DBT, particularly in its configuration and deployment aspects
Proficiency in SQL, including window functions
Enthusiastic about understanding and optimizing database engine mechani





What we offer 🎁

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability

The opportunity to do career-defining work in a fast-growing French-born scale up

The possibility to work as part of a globally diverse team with more than 50 nationalities

Two days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association

Significant investment in your learning and growth

Competitive compensation and benefits package (i.e 28 days of paid time off)

As full member of our entrepreneurial project, you will be eligible to free shares

Surveys show that women and members of underrepresented communities only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the required conditions. Does this sound like you? If so, Vestiaire Collective encourages you to reconsider your application. We look forward to receiving your application!

Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer

Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 700 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are Activism, Transparency, Dedication and Greatness and Collective. We are proud to be a BCorp.

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
At Digital Turbine, we make mobile advertising experiences more meaningful and rewarding for users, app publishers, and advertisers — intelligently connecting people in more ways, across more devices. We provide app publishers and advertisers with powerful ads and experiences that captivate consumers, fuel performance, and help telecoms and OEMs supercharge awareness, acquisition, and monetization. In a rapidly evolving industry, we are constantly innovating and creating better paths of discovery to connect consumers, publishers, and advertisers across the mobile ecosystem.

About the Role:


Create highly scalable and fault tolerant technical designs working with team members (up to 5 people).
Develop and implement data pipelines that extracts, transforms and loads data into an information product that helps to inform the organization in reaching strategic goals.
Write high-quality code, conduct and participate in code reviews, and follow strong engineering principles and standards.
Research the technical feasibility of new ideas and actively suggest technology improvements.
Quickly develop a thorough understanding of the product, architecting the system and shipping production ready code.
Write maintainable code that can scale fast.
Support and contribute to our amazing work culture.


About You:


Deep experience & understanding of object-oriented design, design patterns, micro services architecture, data structure, algorithms and their complexities, and systems architecture
Skilled in writing and automating tests for your code
Proven working experience with cloud platforms.
Demonstrated experience with OLTP databases, specifically MySQL (understanding of day to day challenges related to query execution and optimization, e.g. indexing and cascading)
Working experience with big data aggregation frameworks (Spark)
Experience with streaming platforms like kafka and rabbitMQ
Experience working in an agile environment
Experience with C++ or any front-end framework is a plus
Excellent spoken and written communication skills in English


Big Data Skills:


3+ years of experience with writing code in Scala
Experience with Python, Spark, Airflow
Experience with Scala testing frameworks
Understanding of data-warehousing and data-modeling techniques
Proven experience with writing code for spark data processing
Familiarity with various OLAP data stores (Druid, Clickhouse etc) and their insights
Experience with at least one columnar OLAP databases
Familiarity with industry-standard analytics and visualization tools

Title: Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) CRM
Description:
Die Verti Versicherung AG ist Deutschlands zweitgrößter Kfz-Direktversicherer. Das 1996 gegründete Unternehmen zählt mehr als eine Million Bestandspolicen. Verti beschäftigt etwa 500 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter am Hauptfirmensitz in Teltow bei Berlin sowie am 2018 neu gegründeten Standort in Vaterstetten bei München. Verti ist seit 2015 Teil der MAPFRE Gruppe und firmierte bis 2017 als Direct Line. Ausgehend vom Prämienvolumen ist MAPFRE unter den Top 15 der größten Versicherungsgruppen in Europa. Verti ist die weltweite Digitalmarke von MAPFRE. Seit 2018 ist Verti Namensgeber einer der modernsten Veranstaltungsstätten Europas: der Verti Music Hall in Berlin.

Um unseren Kunden passgenaue Produkte und einen bestmöglichen Service anbieten zu können, ist die Analyse und Interpretation von Daten essentiell. Als Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) im Bereich Clients bei Verti liegt Dein Fokus auf der Datenaufbereitung und -analyse unserer Bestandskundendaten. Ziel ist es, unsere Kunden noch zielgruppengerechter anzusprechen und dadurch stärker an uns zu binden. Die Interaktion und der lösungsorientierte Austausch im eigenen Team aber vor allem auch mit anderen datengetriebenen Unternehmensbereichen ist uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nutze die Möglichkeit, Deine Expertise erfolgreich einzubringen und Analysen zu erarbeiten, die Grundlage für richtungsweisende Entscheidungen bei Verti sein können. Werde Teil unseres dynamischen und multikulturellen Clients Bereichs.

Verti ist auf Wachstumskurs und sucht Dich zur Verstärkung als Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) in Teltow bei Berlin.

Die Position ist in Vollzeit zu besetzen.

Aufgaben


Extrahierung von Bestandskunden-Daten, Durchführung von komplexen Datenanalysen und Erarbeitung von Prognosemodellen zur Lösung datengetriebener Fragestellungen und zur Generierung von Customer Insights entlang der gesamten Customer Journey
Definition von Zielstellungen für die bestandserhalt- oder kundenwertfördernden Aktionen gemeinsam mit dem CRM-Team
Evaluierung der Erreichung der genannten Ziele im Erfolgsmonitoring
Aufbereitung von aussagekräftigen Dashboards zur kontinuierlichen Erfolgskontrolle und Überwachung der Entwicklung der relevanten Customer KPIs
Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen zur Förderung des Bestandserhalts oder der Kundenwerterhöhung und Kommunikation dieser im eigenen Team sowie an das Management
Schnittstelle zu anderen datenverarbeitenden Bereichen im Unternehmen wie dem Data Warehouse, Versicherungsmathematik oder Data & Analytics


Profil


Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium mit relevantem Schwerpunkt (Betriebswirtschaft, Informatik, Statistik, Mathematik etc.) oder eine abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung mit entsprechender Weiterbildung
Relevante Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data/ Customer Analytics
Idealerweise erste Berufserfahrung im versicherungsmathematischen Bereich, Erfahrungen im Umfeld der Kfz- und Sachversicherung
Erfahrung im Umgang mit SQL-basierten Anwendungen und Statistiitkprogrammen, Sicherer Umgang mit den gängigen MS Office-Anwendungen
Deutschkenntnisse mind. Level C1, sehr gute Englischkenntnisse
Sehr gutes analytisches Denkvermögen, schnelle Auffassungsgabe, selbstständige, ergebnisorientierte sowie proaktive Arbeitsweise
Fähigkeit, komplexe Fragestellungen klar und verständlich zu visualisieren und zu kommunizieren
Sicheres Auftreten, Durchsetzungsfähigkeit und gute Präsentationsfähigkeiten
Arbeitserlaubnis der Europäischen Union


Wir bieten

Arbeiten und Wohlfühlen: Du sollst Dich bei uns wohlfühlen und erfolgreich sein können. Dafür bieten wir Dir beste Rahmenbedingungen:


Einen unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag mit einem Jahresurlaubsanspruch von 30 Tagen plus Betriebsferien am 24. und 31. Dezember
39-Stundenwoche
Vielfältige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und Karrierechancen
Flexible Arbeitszeiten sowie die Möglichkeit zum mobilen Arbeiten
Diverses Kollegium in einem internationalen Konzernumfeld
Professionelles Onboarding
Moderner und ergonomisch gestalteter Arbeitsplatz
Subventionierte Kantine mit Kaffeebar
Firmeneigenes Fitnessstudio sowie diverse Sport- und Gesundheitsangebote (u.a. kostenfreier Yoga-Unterricht, Massage- und Physiotherapieangebot, Tischtennisplatte)
Attraktive Mitarbeiterrabatte
Teamevents wie z.B. Teilnahme an Laufveranstaltungen, regelmäßige Volunteering-Aktivitäten, Betriebsfeiern, etc.
Anspruch auf einen Sozialtag pro Jahr zur Ausübung des privaten, ehrenamtlichen Engagements


… und natürlich die vielen tollen Kolleginnen und Kollegen im #TeamVerti

Lokal und Global: Bei uns kannst Du Dich je nach Aufgabengebiet in internationale Projekte einbringen und in internationalen Teams innerhalb des MAPFRE-Konzerns arbeiten.

Innovation und Expertise: Ein Umfeld, in dem innovative, digitale Ideen wie in einem Start-up vorangetrieben werden - mit der Expertise aus mehr als 25 Jahren Erfahrung in der Versicherungsbranche.

Vielfalt und Nachhaltigkeit: Als Unterzeichner der Charta der Vielfalt stehen wir für Diversität und Gerechtigkeit am Arbeitsplatz. Gender Pay Gap? Nicht bei Verti! Ebenso hat bei uns der verantwortungsvolle Umgang mit Ressourcen einen hohen Stellenwert. Aktuell fokussieren wir uns darauf bis 2024 klimaneutral zu werden.

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Referrals (m/f/x)
Description:
The role

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Referrals Analytics team, you'll play a key role in the Global Virality department. This team works on getting customers to share their HelloFresh experiences and recommend us to their friends. We aim to build a flexible referral program offering attractive deals to customers across the HelloFresh Group. The team is a hyper growth team which contribute to ~30% of the overall business globally.

In this job, you’ll provide important insights that help shape our Digital Product and Commercial strategies. You'll use data to spot trends and find new opportunities that guide our decisions. You'll also help create a data-driven culture in our team, making sure everyone can use data to make smart choices. Your skills in Data Analytics and related technologies, along with your strong communication and organizational abilities, will greatly influence our company’s success.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don’t “tick all the boxes” but think you’d thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You’ll Do


Provide cracking insights to optimize campaign targeting and efficiency of referral program promotions to customers
Analyze customer data to identify pain points and opportunities in the customer journey, helping to determine customer segmentation and personalization strategies.
Creating deep-dives and ad-hoc analysis, research, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
Utilize various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
Improve how we look at Virality Analytics as a group, bringing key analytical insight to various levels across the organization
Work with other analytics departments, driving cross-team collaboration, best practice sharing, and insight generation.


What You’ll Bring


4+ years in a highly analytical role (bonus if you’ve worked in a Start-Up or in a high-growth environment)
Advanced abilities in SQL and python, and the ability to use statistical modeling techniques for robust analysis.
A strong business acumen and can translate insights into actionable recommendations that align with business objectives
Expertise in data visualization and data storytelling, including experience with dashboarding tools (Tableau preferred)
Experience working with a range of business stakeholders and communicating technical results in business language
A BS in computer science, mathematics, economics, statistics, engineering, or similar program


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access,wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

Title: Financial Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Deine Aufgaben


Du entwickelst eine neue Prozessmodellierung für Finanzdaten und baust sie auf
Dabei erstellst du neue Dashboards und Auswertungen zur Datenanalyse und visualisierst Trends
Du bringst dein Erfahrungswissen bei Entscheidungsgrundlagen für das Management ein und bereitest diese vor
Du wirkst aktiv bei der Implementierung neuer Applikationen und Tools mit und bist für die erforderliche Anpassung von Geschäftsprozessen mitverantwortlich
Deine Expertise bringst du proaktiv bei der Aufbereitung verschiedener finanzrelevanter Projekte ein
In direkter Berichtslinie arbeitest du eng mit unserem Vice President Finance & Admin zusammen


Dein Profil


Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium in einem wirtschaftswissenschaftlichen Bereich vorzugsweise mit dem Schwerpunkt Finanzen, oder eine abgeschlossene, kaufmännische Ausbildung
Du bist erfahren in der Erstellung von Reports und Präsentationen (mittels BI Tools und MS Office)
Deine Argumentationssicherheit basiert auf Zahlen, Daten & Fakten
Du bist eine eigenständige und selbstorganisierte Arbeitsweise gewohnt, dabei aber ein Teamplayer
Du bringst Passion und Freude an der Analyse und Auswertung von Daten und digitalen Lösungen mit
Du verfügst über Kommunikationsstärke und eine Ausgeprägte Service- und Kundenorientierung
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse


Freu Dich Drauf


Zukunftsweisende Technologien für den Alltag entwickeln
Spannende Projekte und vielfältige Aufgabenfelder mit großer Wirkung
Gestaltungsfreiraum und Eigenverantwortung bei der Entwicklung von Qualitätsprodukten zum Anfassen
Flexibles Arbeiten mit der Option, mehrere Tage pro Woche im Homeoffice zu arbeiten
44 Euro Beitrag zum Deutschlandticket
Vermögenswirksame Leistungen in Höhe von 27 Euro pro Monat
30 Tage Urlaub sowie Heiligabend und Silvester frei
Individuelle Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und eine offene Voneinander-Lern-Kultur wie z.B. im Rahmen unserer Developer Coffee Breaks
Einzigartige Teamevents, z.B. Grillevents, Weihnachtsfeier und das große AVM Sommerfest, zu dem auch deine Familie miteingeladen ist
Show more
HTML:
Deine Aufgaben

  • Du entwickelst eine neue Prozessmodellierung für Finanzdaten und baust sie auf
  • Dabei erstellst du neue Dashboards und Auswertungen zur Datenanalyse und visualisierst Trends
  • Du bringst dein Erfahrungswissen bei Entscheidungsgrundlagen für das Management ein und bereitest diese vor
  • Du wirkst aktiv bei der Implementierung neuer Applikationen und Tools mit und bist für die erforderliche Anpassung von Geschäftsprozessen mitverantwortlich
  • Deine Expertise bringst du proaktiv bei der Aufbereitung verschiedener finanzrelevanter Projekte ein
  • In direkter Berichtslinie arbeitest du eng mit unserem Vice President Finance & Admin zusammen

Dein Profil

  • Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium in einem wirtschaftswissenschaftlichen Bereich vorzugsweise mit dem Schwerpunkt Finanzen, oder eine abgeschlossene, kaufmännische Ausbildung
  • Du bist erfahren in der Erstellung von Reports und Präsentationen (mittels BI Tools und MS Office)
  • Deine Argumentationssicherheit basiert auf Zahlen, Daten & Fakten
  • Du bist eine eigenständige und selbstorganisierte Arbeitsweise gewohnt, dabei aber ein Teamplayer
  • Du bringst Passion und Freude an der Analyse und Auswertung von Daten und digitalen Lösungen mit
  • Du verfügst über Kommunikationsstärke und eine Ausgeprägte Service- und Kundenorientierung
  • Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Freu Dich Drauf

  • Zukunftsweisende Technologien für den Alltag entwickeln
  • Spannende Projekte und vielfältige Aufgabenfelder mit großer Wirkung
  • Gestaltungsfreiraum und Eigenverantwortung bei der Entwicklung von Qualitätsprodukten zum Anfassen
  • Flexibles Arbeiten mit der Option, mehrere Tage pro Woche im Homeoffice zu arbeiten
  • 44 Euro Beitrag zum Deutschlandticket
  • Vermögenswirksame Leistungen in Höhe von 27 Euro pro Monat
  • 30 Tage Urlaub sowie Heiligabend und Silvester frei
  • Individuelle Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und eine offene Voneinander-Lern-Kultur wie z.B. im Rahmen unserer Developer Coffee Breaks
  • Einzigartige Teamevents, z.B. Grillevents, Weihnachtsfeier und das große AVM Sommerfest, zu dem auch deine Familie miteingeladen ist

Title: Senior Revenue Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

What makes the Finance team so special is our ‘service first’ approach to the job - we enjoy creating strong communication loops with the wider business, so that bottlenecks are minimized and that things get done quickly and efficiently.

Everybody is accountable for their own workload and takes pride in being meticulous and precise. We also enjoy learning and developing as we go - it’s important that you share this approach!

Day-to-day:


Provide support in the implementation of our revenue subledger to scale our revenue accounting to the next level
Work closely with Product, Analytics and Engineering on country rollouts and data validations
Manage cross functional processes with Product, Analytics, Engineering and other Accounting process owners, to collect and implement accounting requirements from the business related to revenue data flow
Perform proactive in-depth accounting analysis, measurement, and reconciliations of key revenue accounts
Prepare deliverables for external audit review and testing, and SOX control documentation for internal audit teams
Detect and resolve data issues and reconciliation gaps
Ad hoc analyses and projects as assigned


Our humble expectations


Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, Data Science or related field
Intermediate/Advanced SQL skills and ability to pull and work with large volumes of transactional data
5-7 years of experience in Accounting/Data Analytics or related field
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with demonstrated understanding of Accounting processes
Clear and concise communication with strong cross-functional partnership experience
Experience with Snowflake, NetSuite, Looker preferred
Data-obsessed and unafraid to go down to the lowest level of detail for truth
You are able to balance between attention to detail and swift execution
Experience in the gig economy or marketplace company is a plus
Comfortable using English as a working language
Must be eligible to work in the E.U.


Next Steps

Why you'll love working with us


Continuous learning: Significant growth in a fast-scaling global tech firm.
Competitive compensation: Attractive salary package including stock options.
Flexible environment: Embrace a hybrid work model, blending office presence with flexibility.


If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!

We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, so if this sounds like an opportunity you want to pursue, apply today!

If you have any further questions about the position, you can turn to: Talent Acquisition Partner - timur.novopashin@wolt.com

Please note that we do not accept applications coming through email due to GDPR. Make sure to apply through our careers page, and submit your application in English!

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt works together with over 30,000 restaurant and retail partners as well as with over 60,000 courier partners across 27 countries and 210 cities.

Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest reviews, largely because of our customer-centric approach to how we build our products and operations. For example, our customer service team responds in a matter of seconds, in the customer’s own language.

In 2020, the Financial Times named us Europe’s second fastest growing company. We’re still expanding rapidly and are looking for more talented individuals to join us. If you are passionate about cutting-edge technology, great food, and making an impact in your city, then Wolt just might be for you.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics (Attribution & Paid Search)
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics and will focus mostly on helping optimize our Paid Search operations and scaling our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. The analyst will need to intervene in our campaign setup and bidding strategies and our attribution and experimentation solutions.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value…)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Previous experience in marketing attribution and paid search.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.
Show more

Title: Data Excellence Senior Associate (x/f/m)
Description:
What You’ll Do

Doctolib is looking for a Data excellence senior associate to strengthen the newly created HCP (Healthcare Practitioners) Data Platform team.

Your main missions will be to :


Maximize our Prospects Target addressable market to enable Sales & Marketing growth
Improve our database quality
Join forces with our product and ops teams to scale our processes



As a Data excellence senior associate, you will be the main point of contact of our local sales & marketing teams based in France, Germany and Italy.

Your responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Be the main point of contact regarding prospect data :


Work with all business teams to propose the right governance & business processes to ensure our data standards (eg. Sales, Marketing, Finance, Legal, Products…)
Propose ambitious roadmaps to achieve our goals



Lead complex data excellence projects:


Lead, scope, drive & deliver data excellence projects (data analysis, data strategy, quality, data sourcing, Sales processes & change management, etc.)
Build scalable & lasting solutions by yourself or via our internal partners (Data Analytics, Data Operations, Product teams)
Ensure our database is efficient, complete & accurate and provide market knowledge on our prospect & competitors (Salesforces, MDM)



Who You Are

If you don’t meet all the requirements below but believe this opportunity matches your expectations and experience, we still encourage you to apply!

You could be our next team mate if you:


You have at least 3 to 5 years of experience as a consultant, business or data analyst with strong business & data sense. You also have a fast and successful track record in a B2B SaaS company or consulting firm;
You’re highly proficient in writing SQL queries, including complex joins, and have extensive experience working with large databases.;
You have experience in leading projects
English is mandatory, French / German / Italian are a plus.



Now, it would be fantastic if you have:


Python knowledge & development experience
Experience with CRM (e.g. Salesforces) or MDM (Reltio)



Was wir Dir bieten


ein Aktienoptionsprogramm für alle Doctoliber
eine betriebliche Krankenversicherung mit tollen Zusatzleistungen
Vierteljährlicher (oder monatlicher Bonus) und ein kompetitives Gehaltspaket
28 Urlaubstage + 1 Tag zusätzlich für jedes volle Beschäftigungs-Kalenderjahr (max. 30 Tage)
Das Doctolib Parent Care Programm, das extra Elternzeit (1 Monat) uvm. enthält
Solidarity Days: 2 Tage pro Jahr, um Wohltätigkeitsorganisationen im Gesundheitswesen zu unterstützen
Mentales Wohlbefinden durch Zugang zu Coaches und Psychologen in Zusammenarbeit mit externen Partnern
Ein flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell, das hybrides- und Büro-basiertes Arbeiten ermöglicht
Flexibility Days: 10 Tage im Jahr aus dem EU-Ausland oder UK arbeiten
Erstattung der ÖPNV-Kosten oder Firmenwagen (nur für den Field Sales)
Verpflegung Budget und gesunde Snacks im Büro
Ein gefördertes Sportangebot mit unserem Partner Urban Sports Club



The interview process


HR screen interview
Hiring Manager Interview
Case study + Case Restitution
At least one reference check



Job details


Permanent position
Full Time
Workplace : Berlin
Start date : ASAP
Remuneration : fix + bonus on objectives (according to your profile)



A stock options plan for every Doctoliber

At Doctolib, we believe in improving access to healthcare for everyone - regardless of where you come from, what you look like. This translates into our recruitment process: Doctolib is an equal opportunity employer. We don't just accept diversity at Doctolib, we respect and celebrate it!

The more diverse ideas are heard, the more our product will truly improve healthcare for all. You are welcome to apply to Doctolib, regardless of your gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, or place of origin. If you have a disability, let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process smoother for you!

All the information transmitted via this form is processed by Doctolib for the purpose of managing applications. For more information on how Doctolib processes your application data, click here.

If you wish to exercise your rights or if you have any questions about the processing of your data, you can write to us at hr.dataprivacy@doctolib.com.
